content.prompt: The cadence ending the fanfare includes a secondary leading-tone seventh chord that tonicizes Ⅴ. What voice-leading feature is present?

choices.label: The seventh of the leading-tone chord resolves to the third of the tonicized chord.
The fifth of the leading-tone chord prepares a Ⅴ4-3 cadential pattern.
The third of the leading-tone chord is suspended to create a Ⅴ6/4-5/3 pattern.
The root of the leading tone chord becomes the fifth of the tonicized chord via voice exchange.

unit.text: 7: Harmony and Voice Leading IV - Secondary Function

topic.text: 7.4: Part Writing of Secondary Leading Tone Chords

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in performed music.
